abstract.p: This essay examines the shape of a constitutive Baptist rhetoric in order to discover ways Baptist identity functions as a source of rhetorical invention. A Matrix of Contemporary Christian Voices is employed to array differences among Baptists in their expression of denominational identity and to discover limits as to what it means to think like a Baptist.
